document.masterDocTitle: A review of neococcid scale insects (Hemiptera: Sternorrhyncha: Coccomorpha) based on the morphology of the adult males

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of neococcid scale insects (Hemiptera: Sternorrhyncha: Coccomorpha) based on the morphology of the adult males

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined .
Zimbabwe
(Rhodesia), Mazoe, on
Brachystegia
sp., 8.x.1927 , W.J. Hall ( BMNH ): 3/7ad â™‚â™‚ (in fairly poor condition, four uncleared and 3 cleared and stained but badly mounted and damaged. One of the uncleared specimens was surprisingly clear and this was used for the description, with some details confirmed from the other specimens).

Mounted material : quite small, total body length about 1.25 mm ; antennae short, six segmented; body setae few but some quite long (31â€“55 Î¼m), particular on abdomen. Wings well-developed and broad.

Head : appearing almost round in dorsal view; width across genae about 211 Î¼m. Median crest (mc) broad, par- ticularly posteriorly, striated or reticulated; postoccipital ridge (por) absent; with (on each side) 13 fs + 1 hs dorsal head setae (dhs). Mid-cranial ridge: dorsal ridge (dmcr) absent; ventral ridge (vmcr) with well-developed lateral branches (lmcr) and a long medial ridge; with a few striations laterally; with 1 or 2 fs + 0 or 1 hs ventral mid-cranial ridge setae (vmcrs) on each side. Genae (g) without reticulations; genal setae (gs): 9â€“11 fs + 1â€“3 hs on each side posterior to dorsal part of postocular ridge. Eyes: with two pairs of round simple eyes; dorsal eyes (dse) near antennae, subequal in width to ventral eyes (vse) (near mouth), each 34â€“40 Î¼m wide. Ocelli (o) quite large, 21â€“22 Î¼m wide. Ocular sclerite (ocs) without polygonal reticulations. Preocular ridge (procr) very small or absent. Interocular ridge absent. Postocular ridge (pocr) strongly developed, extending a short distance dorsally past posterior margin of each ocellus. Dorsal ocular setae (docs) absent. Ventral head setae (vhs): 13â€“15 fs + 2 hs on each side and with 1 pair of fs posterior to ventral eyes. Preoral ridge (pror) and cranial apophysis (ca) not visible.

Antennae : 6-segmented and filiform, total length 311â€“330 Î¼m (total body length to antennal length ratio 1:0.27). Scape (scp): 33â€“42 Î¼m long and 43 Î¼m wide, with 2? fs + 2 hs. Pedicel (pdc): length 30 Î¼m, width 38 Î¼m; possibly with a few concentric ridges; with 6â€“7 fs + 2 hs. Fleshy setae about 28 Î¼m long. Segment III 40 Î¼m wide distally and 133 Î¼m long, with 11â€“20 fs + 3 hs; segment IV 55 Î¼m long, with 9â€“12 fs, 2â€“4 hs + 1 bristle; segment V 45 Î¼m long, with 8â€“9 fs, 3â€“4 hs + 1 bristle; segment VI slightly constricted apically, 47 Î¼m long, with 3 bristles, possibly 1 fs + 3 capitate setae. No sensilla basiconica detected.

Thorax . Prothorax : pronotal ridge (prnr) well-developed but not fused dorsally; lateral pronotal sclerite (prn) rather narrow; without lateral pronotal (lpns) setae. Medial pronotal setae, post-tergites and post-tergital setae probably absent. Sternum (stn 1 ) not sclerotised and with only a very slight suggestion of a medial ridge posteriorly; transverse ridge quite strong; with 4â€“7 fs prosternal setae (stn 1 s) on each side. Anteprosternal (astn 1 s) and antemesospiracular setae (am 2 s) absent.

Mesothorax : prescutum (prsc) rectangular, about 91 Î¼m long (but posterior margin indistinct as fused with sclerotised scutum) and about 195 Î¼m wide; with large reticulations/nodulations throughout; prescutal ridges (pscr) and prescutal suture (pscs) absent; with 8 fs near each lateral margin. Scutum (sct) without a median membranous area, this area sclerotised, with large reticulations/nodulations and separated from prescutum by an area of narrower reticulations; median area about 95 Î¼m long and 132 Î¼m wide; with 4 or 5 fs scutal setae (scts) on each side; lateral margins of scutum with large reticulations and with 7â€“9 fs setae on each side. Prealare ridge fairly weak. Scutellum (scl) 186 Î¼m wide and 50 Î¼m long; possibly tubular, with a large foramen; with 5â€“8 fs scutellar setae (scls) on each side. Basisternum (stn 2 ) 240 Î¼m wide and 145 Î¼m long; without any signs of a median ridge (mdr), but bounded ante- riorly by a strong marginal ridge (mr) and posteriorly by strong precoxal ridges (pcr 2 ); with 8â€“10 fs + 3 hs basisternal setae (stn 2 s) on each side; lateropleurite (lpl) short and narrow with a weak extension from marginal ridge anteriorly; with 2â€“6 setae close to lateral border of lateropleurite; furca (f) well developed, narrow-waisted, arms very divergent and extending almost to marginal ridge. Mesopostnotum (pn 2 ) and postnotal apophysis (pna) well developed. Area bounded anteriorly by scutellum and laterally and posteriorly by mesopostnotum not sclerotised. Mesepisternum (eps 2 ) not reticulated; with 5â€“11 fs + 0 or 1 hs mesepisternal setae (eps 2 s); subepisternal ridge well developed. Postalare (pa) not reticulated anteriorly; without postalare setae (pas). Mesothoracic spiracle (sp 2 ): peritreme 36 Î¼m wide; without disc-pores. Postmesospiracular setae (pm 2 s): with 5â€“9 fs posterior to each mesospiracular spiracle. Tegula (teg) present, with 4 or 5 fs tegular setae (tegs) on each side.

Wings : hyaline, about 1100 Î¼m long and 425 Î¼m wide (ratio of length to width 1:0.39; ratio of total body length to wing length 1:0.88); alar lobe (al) and alar setae (als) absent. Hamulohalteres absent.

Legs : legs subequal in length. Coxae (cx): I 78; II 83; III 78â€“83 Î¼m long; setae of coxa III: about 5 fs + 1 hs; long apical setae on each coxa absent. Trochanter (tr) + femur (fm): I 186â€“200; II 202â€“207; III 198â€“207 Î¼m long; trochanter III with 1 fs + 1 hs; long trochanter seta up to 53 Î¼m long; femur III with about 11 fs + 6 hs. Tibia (ti): I 178â€“187; II 207â€“212; III 211â€“216 Î¼m; tibia III with a total of about 42 setae, mainly fs with a few hs; with two distinct apical spurs (tibs), length 25â€“27 Î¼m. Tarsi (ta): I 92; II 100; III 95 Î¼m long (ratio of lenth of tibia III to tarsus III 1:0.45); tarsus III with 13 setae; tarsal campaniform pore present; tarsus each with 2 distinct spurs, each 15â€“17 Î¼m long; tarsal digitules (tdt) unusual, as in family diagnosis. Claws (c) of unusual shape as in family diagnosis; length: III 31â€“35 Î¼m; claw digitules (cdt) subequal in length to claw, with small apical knobs.

Abdomen : segments Iâ€“VII: tergites (at) of Vâ€“VII probably slightly sclerotised; sternites (as) unsclerotised. Caudal extension (ce) of segment VII absent. Dorsal setae (ads) (on each side): segments Iâ€“VII each with 2 or 3 hs. Pleural setae: dorsopleural setae (dps) (on each side): Iâ€“VII each with 4â€“6 hs; ventropleural setae (vps) (on each side): Iâ€“VII each with 1 hs. Ventral setae (avs) (on each side): IIâ€“VII each with 2 large + 1 small hs.

Segment VIII: tergite (at) distinctly sclerotised, with 1 large hs dorsal abdominal setae on each side; sternite (as) possibly unsclerotised; with a single ventral abdominal seta (avs); caudal extension (ce) small, with 2 small hs pleural setae. Glandular pouches (gp) present and shallow; length of glandular pouch setae 207â€“248 Î¼m.

Genital segments : penial sheath (ps) apparently composed of a broad heavily sclerotised segment IX, 91 Î¼m long and 91 Î¼m wide; anus present medially on dorsum; and with 2 or 3 pairs of long hs ventro-laterally; segment IX separated from style by a moderately wide unsclerotised band or segmental membrane; style wide anteriorly, rapidly narrowing to a fine needle-like apex; style about half total length of penial sheath; style with 3 pairs of very long hs dorso-laterally on anterior half and with 2 pairs of small pores on narrow posterior part, one pair apically and other about half-way. Aedeagus bulbous anteriorly, quickly narrowing to a narrow needle-like proximal part but latter slightly wider and longer than penial sheath; basal rod broad distally but extending posteriorly and fading down length of aedeagus. Total length of style from posterior margin of IX 151 Î¼m; width of style anteriorly 50 Î¼m. Length of aedeagus 170 Î¼m; length of basal rod approximately 58 Î¼m.

Comment. For a comparison with
P. multispinosus
see under that species below.
